intro: Psychotria coeloneura, commonly known as the "blue hoya" or "blue psychotria," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Psychotria coeloneura is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant.
